question1.title: How to present ribs?
question1.text: I have years of experience making ribs- at home. I've recently been employed as a junior chef at a somewhat upscale restaurant, and have been empowered to create my own dishes for the menu. I want to do ribs, but I don't know how to plate them in a way that fits the classy environment while acknowledging the inherent mess of ribs.

question2.title: What is your favorite food to eat/ make?
question2.text: I'm trying to get a survey of the culinary tastes of this site. So what's everyone's favorites?

question3.title: Is store bought kimchi paste okay, or will my in-laws disown me?
question3.text: Read the username, I'm new to this. I know store bought anything is less 'authentic', but I'm scared of messing it up if I make my own. Worth the risk or will they know?

question4.title: Can I grill as a college student?
question4.text: I've been a lurker here for a couple months now and I'm constantly dreaming of grilled food. Unfortunately, I'm living in a student dorm with only one battered pot to my name. Any tips for lowkey grilling?

question5.title: What is the perfect syrup to waffle ratio?
question5.text: Every morning when I eat my waffle with syrup in all quadrants, it always gets too soggy with syrup. If I reduce it to two qudrants, it's just too dry. What is the optimal syrup ratio?

question6.title: Do I need an electric mixer?
question6.text: Over the past year I've been convincing myself to take my cake baking to a semi-professional level, and I'm finally making the step. I've been experimenting with original cakes to present to the local cake shop to see if I can get employed there. My daughter was horrified to learn I'd been using a hand mixer for all of it. I've used a hand mixer longer than she's been alive, I don't trust the stir on those machine things. But if I'm going to be doing a lot of baking, maybe I need to invest in one. What do people here think?

question7.title: Can you cook rice in an air fryer?
question7.text: I don't have a pot. I would just go for it but rice is sticky sometimes and I don't want to mess up my air fryer...

question8.title: What kind of fish have the best bones for stock?
question8.text: I'm trying to experiment with fish bone stock for soup, but some of those fish get pretty pricey per pound. What's a good cheap fish to start off with?

question9.title: Can we talk about the culture on PO...
question9.text: I've been noticing a real uptick in antagonism and unsportsmanlike behavior on this site. At the end of the day, we're all men of curiosity. Can't we just get along?

question10.title: I've been meaning to try a new glaze for pork roast. Recommendations?
question10.text: What it says in the title. I'm trying this on my own before potentially introducing it to the menu. Italian restaurant.

question11.title: What's the best way to scramble eggs?
question11.text: I'm a college student trying to stay healthy living alone for the first time. Eggs seem easy, but everyone disagrees on how to make them. What's the best way to do it?
